column4: Hey guys, I've got no audio in my browser, out of the blue.  It was working 5 minutes ago but now its dead.  I get sound from music players etc, still.  This is the third time its happened.  Nothing new has been installed to make this happen, to my knowledge.  Im on Ubuntu Wubi.  Any ideas?
what if you restart your browser?
i'd restart your pc, next time it dies and as soon as it dies run: dmesg | tail
you could also try restarting hal / alsa / pulse
its in here: https://help.ubuntu.com/community/OperaBrowser
you will also need to set it in other apps that have their own browser knowledge if they do not tap into the default one (or if you have statically set it in an app)
this should be as simple as checking a boix.  It has been in every other Opera release.  Im not reading your long-ass link, it doesnt have the info I asked for.
it does if you press ctrl + f and type default
i didnt expect you to read it all
http://my.opera.com/Tamil/blog/set-opera-as-default-browser
welcome to ignore. you are so ungrateful
not so
frets on fire, penumbra, deusex, doom3 run fantastically
intel video is garbage
no games work well for me on jaunty, only in Windows.  I hate jaunty for it.
its not jaunty, its the wine team
no, it is a completely seperate app
I dont use wine for gaming, I play linux native games and still only get 30fps MAX
then its the team who made the game native installer, its a seperate app made by different guys, so is not ubuntu's fault
i'd head to offtopic
i use it as it plays nice with my g1 phone :)
I thought it was just like a basic IM but lacking in most commands and functionality.  I wouldnt know, like I stated in my previous statement, I dont use it.
somone said to use gksudo instead of sudo for particular tasks.  Do you have a link to info about that?
